did.abstract: The Ypsilanti Campaign for Equality (YCFE) organization was formed in about 2001 to contest a ballot proposal that would have removed sexual orientation protections from the Ypsilanti City Charter. This record group comprises the material they amassed during their campaign; it includes budgets, planning documents, literature, and press coverage.

bioghist.p: In 1998, Ypsilanti voters passed a Human Rights Ordinance that prohibited discrimination based on several characteristics, including sexual orientation. In 2001 a petition was circulated to amend the city charter and remove these protections; enough signatures were gathered for a proposal to be added to the ballot in the next city election. Unlawful activities were suspected to have taken place as signatures were gathered and a lawsuit was brought by the Ypsilanti Campaign for Equality and Elizabeth Warren against the Ypsilanti City Clerk (among others) for validating the petition.

Despite the lawsuit the measure remained on the ballot. YCFE campaigned against it by organizing volunteers, educating voters and conducting fundraisers. Their campaign was successful and the ballot measure was defeated in the 2002 city election.

scopecontent.p: This record group is divided into three series: 2002 Campaign (0.7 linear ft., 2001-2002), Electronic Records (3.5" Disks and CD-R, 2001-2002) and Ypsilanti Campaign for Equality and Elizabeth Warren Eddins vs. Ypsilanti City Clerk, City of Ypsilanti, Washtenaw County Election Commission and Washtenaw County Clerk (0.2 linear ft., 1998-2002).

The 2002 Campaign series comprises all those materials that were clearly connected to the campaign. It includes administrative materials, such as budgets and planning documents; literature distributed by the YCFE and its opposition; and press coverage published throughout the duration of the campaign. It also details the efforts of organizing and training campaign volunteers and includes documentation of supporters in the business and religious community.

scopecontent.p: The Electronic Records series consists of various campaign files, sometimes duplicating those found in the 2002 Campaign series. There is one CD-R that includes a large quantity of material and may have acted as a backup of all campaign files. There are 14 3.5" disks which include files that sometimes duplicate materials found in the 2002 Campaign series; also included are materials related to the "Get Out The Vote" (GOTV) efforts.

scopecontent.p: The Ypsilanti Campaign for Equality and Elizabeth Warren Eddins vs. Ypsilanti City Clerk, City of Ypsilanti, Washtenaw County Election Commission and Washtenaw County Clerk series encompasses those materials that were generated by or directly related to this legal proceeding. These include court orders and opinions, legal briefs, and the text of the petition under scrutiny.
